intro: Alchemilla acutiloba subsp. pontica, commonly known as the Pontic lady’s mantle, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It features basal leaves that are palmately lobed and covered in a dense layer of silky, white hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodland edges or stream banks. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and its historical use in traditional medicine.
